conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles A and B based on their velocity-time graphs.
The graph shows the velocity of each particle as a function of time.
Identify the acceleration phases for particles A and B.
Acceleration occurs when the velocity changes from zero to a constant value.
For particle A, the velocity increases from 0 to 2v0 over time t0, indicating constant acceleration.
For particle B, the velocity increases from 0 to v0 over time t0, indicating constant acceleration.
Calculate the acceleration for both particles, which is constant as they accelerate from rest to a constant velocity.
Determine the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for A and B.
Conclude the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations for A and B.
